erect.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to build something such as a building or wall
erect.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
erect.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: to fix all the pieces of something together, and put it in an upright position
erect.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
erect.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: to establish something such as a system or institution
erect.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Martin stood erect on the platform.
erect.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: an erect penis or nipple is stiff and bigger than it usually is because a person is sexually excited
